required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Gene Expression in Hyperparathyroidism: Identifying Molecular Differences in MEN1 Patients Versus Young MEN1 Negative Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives:
1. To better define the differences in molecular genetics of parathyroid tumors in patients with MEN1, single gland parathyroid disease in patients less than 50 years old and single gland disease in patients greater than 50 years old.
2. To better define the incidence of HRPT2 mutation in young patients with primary hyperparathyroidism and determine whether routine testing in these patients is indicated.

detailed_description.textblock: Patient charts will be reviewed to collect demographic data, pre-operative and post-operative clinical and laboratory data, operative reports, and pathology reports. Archived formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue blocks from surgical specimens of patients will be stained for parafibromin to evaluate for HRPT2 mutations.

primary_outcome.description: RNA isolated from banked frozen tissues. cDNA microarray prepared using an Illumina array chip. Results analyzed using Ingenuity analysis software to detect 2-fold changes in gene expression. T-statistics used to determine significantly discriminating genes.

secondary_outcome.description: Archived formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue blocks from surgical specimens of patients stained for parafibromin to evaluate for HRPT2 mutations.

arm_group.description: Participants under 50 years of age who have been diagnosed with MEN1-negative primary hyperparathyroidism.

intervention.description: Patient charts will be reviewed to collect demographic data, pre-operative and post-operative clinical and laboratory data, operative reports, and pathology reports.
Archived formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue blocks from surgical specimens of patients stained for parafibromin to evaluate for HRPT2 mutations.

biospec_descr.textblock: Parathyroid tissue previously obtained during surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with parathyroid tumors at MD Anderson Cancer Center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. All patients previously enrolled in parathyroid tissue banking under protocol Lab08-0034.
2. For the subgroup designated for HRPT2 mutation testing:
Patients with primary hyperparathyroidism who are younger than 50 years of age and have tested negative for MEN1, between January 1, 1980 and the present.
Exclusion Criteria:

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center

link.description: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center Website
